transportAdvice: Kyoto is well served by an extensive bus network and a subway system that connects major tourist districts, making public transit a practical and affordable way to get around. Many central attractions are walkable or reachable by bicycle, and taxis are widely available though more expensive than transit.

weather.description: Cold and crisp winter days with occasional frost; snow is possible but rarely heavy, making for atmospheric temple visits.
Still cold but early plum blossoms begin to appear, offering a first hint of spring color.
Temperatures rise noticeably and cherry blossom season approaches toward month's end, drawing large crowds.
Peak cherry blossom season in early April makes this one of the most popular and crowded times to visit.
Warm and pleasant with lush green foliage; a comfortable month for sightseeing before summer heat arrives.
The rainy season brings frequent rain and rising humidity, though gardens and moss temples look especially lush.
Hot and very humid with intense heat; traditional summer festivals add cultural interest despite the uncomfortable conditions.
The hottest month of the year with high humidity; early morning visits to temples are strongly recommended.
Typhoon season brings occasional heavy rain and lingering heat, though temperatures gradually begin to ease.
Comfortable autumn temperatures and the start of fall foliage make this one of the best months to visit.
Peak autumn foliage in mid to late November draws large crowds; crisp air and vivid colors make for spectacular scenery.
Cool and quiet as tourist crowds thin out; early winter atmosphere with illuminated temple events adds seasonal charm.
